Title: RHSA-2020:4694: container-tools:rhel8 security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Moderate)
Description:
The container-tools module contains tools for working with containers, notably podman, buildah, skopeo, and runc.

Security Fix(es):

* containernetworking/plugins: IPv6 router advertisements allow for MitM attacks on IPv4 clusters (CVE-2020-10749)

* QEMU: slirp: networking out-of-bounds read information disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2020-10756)

* golang.org/x/text: possibility to trigger an infinite loop in encoding/unicode could lead to crash (CVE-2020-14040)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Bugzillas.Title: [RFE] Default location of setting up HTTP_Proxy for podman
podman docker command fails at COPY - overwriting existing file
container-tools: Provides: docker gone from podman-docker subpackage
"podman login" writes auth.json in a location "skopeo copy" does not expect
Podman segmentation error when a Dockerfile specifies an image by its digest
Podman support for FIPS Mode requires a bind mount inside the container [container-tools-rhel8-rhel-8.3.0/podman]
Podman support for FIPS Mode requires a bind mount inside the container [stream-container-tools-rhel8-rhel-8.2.0/podman]
[RFE] HTTP/REST API for podman
"podman exec -it" will hang with leading keyboard input
Golang panic when pushing image to a scaled image-registry
Update container-tools 8.3.0 components to stable releases
buildah is not expanding env vars in file paths [stream-container-tools-rhel8-rhel-8.3.0/buildah]
Crash on filtering anonymous images
Podman search does not have pagination support
CVE-2020-10749 containernetworking/plugins: IPv6 router advertisements allow for MitM attacks on IPv4 clusters
CVE-2020-10756 QEMU: slirp: networking out-of-bounds read information disclosure vulnerability
--init feature useless out of the box
Socket-activated Varlink (io.podman.socket) fails after first call
Rootless Podman does not properly close and remove temporary files
Using toolbox with fedora:latest image fails, exec fails with "OCI runtime command not found"
The output from "podman images" is malformed if a repository contains a port
CVE-2020-14040 golang.org/x/text: possibility to trigger an infinite loop in encoding/unicode could lead to crash
error loading kheaders module
Podman build from url failed to get correct temp directory for store files
podman run namespace in man page ambiguous
podman search doesn't add limit to a query against v2. By default v2 returns 100 items.
Podman 1.9.3 fails to run container when /etc/secuity/limits.conf is used
error bind mounting /dev from host into mount namespace
Image tag not derived correctly
Update podman to 2.0.5
Remove oci-seccomp-bpf-hook package from default packages installed by container-tools-rhel8-8.3.0
`podman images --all` fails on images with digest
